messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3211
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/2/2003 12:19:01 AM Central Standard Time, ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/2/2003 12:19:01 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> >vinegar? Why is that? I never heard of that before and I live in
> >Maine.
> >Angela
>
> Oh! Vinegar is yummy on crabs! Especially with old bay seasoning. Can you
> tell I live
> near Maryland (actually in virginia but we vacation in Md and my family
> lives there
>


<<Oh! Vinegar is yummy on crabs! Especially with old bay seasoning. Can you
tell I live
near Maryland (actually in virginia but we vacation in Md and my family lives
there
so I hope that it counts!)<<


I'm pretty sure I tolerated dh's really, really Southern Gothic family long
enough to get "hooked" because everytime I visited them they served copious
quantities of crabmeat sauteed in nothing but Old Bay, vinegar, and pure
butter.... ;-)



~~~ Becky~~~

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president,
or that we are to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only
unpatriotic and servile,
but is morally treasonable to the American public."
---Theodore Roosevelt
